features.featureTitle: Create a Hero/Home section featuring the company name 'Aparna Natural Millets Producer Co. Ltd.', tagline 'Powered by Farmers. Trusted by Families.', and a compelling headline about the 1 TPD Millet Processing Unit project in Rayagada, Odisha

Build an About the Company section explaining the farmer-owned cooperative model, alignment with Odisha Millets Mission (OMM) and PMFME scheme, and the mission to empower tribal farmers while enhancing nutrition in Rayagada

Create a Project Vision & Core Objectives section presenting the vision statement and three core objectives: Assured Procurement (transparent procurement at fairer prices for 500+ FPC members), Post-harvest Loss Reduction (primary and secondary processing to reduce losses and increase marketable value), and Nutrition & Supply (manufacture high-quality millet products for ICDS, Mid-Day Meals, and tribal hostels)

Build a Why Rayagada section explaining the local context (Rayagada as a leading producer of Ragi and minor millets), current market challenges with intermediaries, benefits of local processing to retain value in the district, and projected social impact reaching 500+ direct farmer beneficiaries and thousands of consumers through institutional procurement

Create a Technical Specifications section showcasing the 1 TPD processing design with four key components: Pre-cleaning & Grading (multi-stage aspiration and sieving), De-huller & Destoner (efficient de-hulling with integrated destoner), Pulverizer (variable gap pulverizer for coarse and fine flours), and Roaster & Automatic Packaging (controlled roasting with automated weighing and pouch sealing). Include details about ancillary systems and modular expansion plans to 2-3 TPD

Build a Financial Overview section presenting Total Project Cost (₹1.15 Crore), Means of Finance breakdown (Bank Loan: ₹70.00 Lakhs, Promoter Contribution: ₹4.75 Lakhs, PMFME Subsidy 35%: ₹40.25 Lakhs), and Year 1 projections (Revenue: ₹1.50 Crore, Net Profit: ₹35 Lakhs)

Create a Social & Economic Impact section highlighting three areas: Employment & Inclusion (15 direct jobs for local tribal youth and women), Farmer Livelihoods & Income (increased incomes through assured procurement for 500+ member base), and Nutrition & Local Food Security (supplying hygienic milled millet products to ICDS and MDM to address anemia and child nutrition)

Build a Market Strategy section presenting three channels: B2G (Institutional Offtake to ICDS, Mid-Day Meals, Tribal Hostels), B2B (Retail & Mission Outlets including Odisha Millets Mission outlets and cooperative stores with 25kg bulk SKUs), and B2C (Brand 'Aparna Millets' with 1kg retail SKUs, local-language labeling, and digital outreach targeting health-conscious urban buyers in Odisha)

Create a Value Chain Process section illustrating the end-to-end workflow with five stages: Aggregation (farmer collection and scheduled procurement), Cleaning (primary cleaning to reduce contamination), Processing (de-hulling, milling and roasting operations), and Dispatch (packaging, quality checks and delivery). Include operational KPI targets for Year 1: procurement coverage for 500 members, ≤5% post-harvest loss, product moisture ≤10%, and institutional delivery lead time ≤7 days

Build a Support Requested section addressing government and district administration with four specific requests: Administrative Guidance (facilitate PMFME subsidy clearance and verification visits), Procurement Convergence (inclusion in district procurement lists for ICDS/MDM and tribal hostels), Land & Infrastructure Assistance (help identify industrial shed or expedite clearances), and Linkages & Capacity Building (facilitate introductions to state procurement officers and training collaborations)

Create a Conclusion & Next Steps section outlining three phases: Phase 1 Commissioning (0-3 months: finalize site, install machinery, recruit staff, secure PMFME subsidy), Phase 2 Operationalization (3-9 months: begin procurement cycles, achieve 70% capacity utilization, obtain institutional trial orders), and Phase 3 Scale & Consolidate (9-24 months: expand market reach, introduce fortified SKUs, pursue certification, plan Phase II capacity uplift to 2-3 TPD)

Build a Contact section displaying contact information for Bibhuti Bhusana Mishra (Phone: +919437372707, Email: bibhuti4011@gmail.com) and including an interactive contact form with fields for name, email, phone, subject/inquiry type, and message. The form should allow government officials, investors, and potential customers to submit inquiries

Implement a professional, trustworthy visual design theme that reflects agricultural heritage, cooperative values, and modern processing capabilities. Use warm, earthy tones (avoid blue and purple) inspired by millets and grain, incorporate subtle textures or patterns suggesting farmland or grain processing, and ensure the design conveys both grassroots authenticity and professional credibility suitable for government officials, investors, and customers

Create a responsive navigation system that allows easy access to all major sections (Home, About, Project Vision, Why Rayagada, Technical Specifications, Financial Overview, Social Impact, Market Strategy, Value Chain, Support Requested, Contact) and ensure the entire website is mobile-responsive for viewing on phones and tablets
